issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
have a running instance in a euca VPC which was run without a public IP, but cannot associate an ELIP to the instance.  [~sjones], is there another requirement currently to associate an ELIP?


[root@h-35 ~]# euca-describe-vpcs 
VPC	vpc-372cb7c5	available	192.168.40.0/24	dopt-54d2c9e0	default	false
[root@h-35 ~]# euca-describe-subnets 
SUBNET	subnet-4266c27a	available	vpc-372cb7c5	192.168.40.0/27	26	engcluster0	false	false
[root@h-35 ~]# euca-describe-addresses 
ADDRESS	10.111.230.8		vpc	eipalloc-f2f2bcc0			
[root@h-35 ~]# euca-describe-internet-gateways 
INTERNETGATEWAY	igw-954a5070
ATTACHMENT	vpc-372cb7c5	available
[root@h-35 ~]# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-5adaed6d	000075244194	default
INSTANCE	i-4224cd5d	emi-b001ed00		192.168.40.22	running	mykey	0		m1.small	2015-04-28T19:28:58.602Z	engcluster0			monitoring-disabled		192.168.40.22	vpc-372cb7c5	subnet-4266c27a	instance-store					hvm			sg-d3c00660			x86_64
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-68b72820	subnet-4266c27a	vpc-372cb7c5	000075244194	in-use	192.168.40.22		true
ATTACHMENT		0	attached	2015-04-28T19:28:58.605Z	true
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	192.168.40.22		primary
TAG	instance	i-4224cd5d	euca:node	10.111.5.8
[root@h-35 ~]# euca-associate-address -a eipalloc-f2f2bcc0 -i i-4224cd5d
euca-associate-address: error (InternalFailure): Failed to send message AssociateAddressType to service EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Address.component}. Message payload is of type: AssociateAddressType
[root@h-35 ~]# 


cloud-debug.log snippet:

fields.summary: cannot associate ELIP to instance in VPC

comments.body: [~nurmi], I think your usage is correct, the error response is certainly not an expected one. Is this a clean build from master? if not I would recommend deleting the classcache and retrying after a eucalytpus-cloud service restart (/var/run/eucalyptus/classcache/**/*)

[~sjones], this is a clean build (configure/make/make install/etcetc into an clean install location) from monday:

commit c6577ac58a3fd68ad2a4387956794a8bf5d0397f

The fix for this is small (in case you need it before it is pushed to master):

https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/0eb4d5030324fa9629fb343643cc0773032e2d60

{code}

|TYPE: m1.small       |OS: linux           |AGE: 92            |+------------+---------------+-----------+-+---------------+---------------+|
|RES: r-b0ed2141      |VIRT: HVM           |ZONE: two          ||    VPC     |     SUBNET    |  SEC GRPS |P|    PRIV IP    |     PUB IP    ||
|ACCOUNT ID:          |IMAGE NAME:         |ROOTDEV:           |+------------+---------------+-----------+-+---------------+---------------+|
